example.eg: Melville was a major influence in his writing.
example.egtrans: 他的作品受梅尔维尔影响很大。

example.eg: Illegal downloads pose a major threat to the music industry.
example.egtrans: 非法下载对音乐产业构成了严重的威胁。

example.eg: After five years in the army, he attained the rank of major.
example.egtrans: 在军队里呆了五年后，他获得了少校军衔。

example.eg: The most popular majors at this university are English, commerce, and economics.
example.egtrans: 这所大学最受欢迎的专业是英语、商务和经济学。

dsense.name: major
dsense.guideword: US (student: taking as a main subject)

dsense.name: major in [sth]
dsense.guideword: US (study as main subject) (学科、专业等)

example.eg: The song was written in C-major.
example.egtrans: 这首歌是用C大调创作的。

example.eg: I need to practise my F major scale on the piano.
example.egtrans: 我需要在钢琴上练习弹奏我的F大调音阶。

example.eg: Pachelbel's D-major Canon is a well-known piece.
example.egtrans: 帕赫贝尔的D大调卡农是很有名的作品。

example.eg: We have already completed the major part of the drive there.
example.egtrans: 去往目的地的路程我们已经驶过一半了。

example.eg: In a syllogism, the major premise contains the term that is the predicate of the conclusion.
A major is a person who has reached adulthood.
The drum major was in charge of the rest of the drummers.
The record company that has signed the band is one of the majors.
example.egtrans: 与那支乐队签约的是一家大型唱片公司。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 大型公司, 主要公司

example.eg: The drum major was leading the band down the parade route.
My major field of study is Greek, and I am minoring in art history.

dsense.name: major league
dsense.guideword: US (sports association) (美国体育，尤指棒球)

example.eg: My insurance covers both minor injuries and major surgery.
